result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy Thomas Bedell

records.addlTxt: 9:52 AM Called 22CF73, 22CF142, 22TR226, 22TR227, 22TR228 set for STC. Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randy Thomas Bedell not in court, fails to appear.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Randy Thomas Bedell.  Def fails to appear by any means, $500 posted.  State requests default all of the TR matters including the OWI 1st standard dispo and CF cases ask to forfeit cash and Warrant nationwide.  Attny Pollak stands mute.  Court will default TR's, 22TR227 $200.50 and 3 pts, in 22TR228 $937.50 and 6 pts, Revoke DL for 6 months with credit for any admin suspension, OWI  assessment and Driver safety plan.  22CF142 already has WA, orders WA in other and forfeit cash, which will go toward TR ticket matters first.
Only judge may quash this warrant unless the cash bond is posted in full.

Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randy Thomas Bedell not in court. Def fails to appear. Upon def's failure to appear, State requests warrant and forfeiture of any bond.  Court grants warrant $250 cash, only judge may quash and forfeiture of any bond previously posted.
